meanings.definition: To focus too narrowly on a particular area or subject.
meanings.sent1: He overspecializes in math and forgets about other subjects.
meanings.sent2: She overspecializes in painting, but she also enjoys sculpting.
meanings.sent3: The detective overspecializes in solving only murder cases, ignoring other crimes.
meanings.sent4: The chef overspecializes in making pasta dishes, neglecting other culinary skills.
meanings.sent5: The scientist overspecializes in studying one type of plant, missing out on the diversity of nature.

meanings.definition: To become too specialized in a particular field or skill.
meanings.sent1: The athlete overspecializes in sprinting and struggles in longer races.
meanings.sent2: As a doctor, he overspecializes in cardiology, but he can still treat general health issues.
meanings.sent3: The artist overspecializes in using oil paints, missing out on the beauty of watercolors.
meanings.sent4: The musician overspecializes in playing the guitar, limiting his ability to learn other instruments.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic overspecializes in fixing engines, overlooking the importance of brakes and suspension systems.
